message.content:
cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.PS, cs.AI, cs.CY 

This paper proposes a data-driven method for assessing and reducing party fragmentation in a multi-party political system. The method uses roll call data for congress votes on bills and amendments as a proxy for political preferences and ideology. This suggests that the paper could belong to the categories of cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms), cs.SI (Social and Information Networks), cs.PS (Political Science), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), and cs.CY (Computers and Society). However, given the focus on data analysis and optimization, cs.DS and cs.SI are the most likely categories, followed by cs.PS, cs.AI, and cs.CY.
